snippet: Mitt Romney has yet to explain how he would conduct policy toward the Middle East, or to resolve deep ideological rifts within the Republican Party.
abstract: Mitt Romney is intensifying his efforts to draw a sharp contrast with President Obama on national security in the presidential campaign’s closing stages; beyond his critique of Obama as failing to project American strength abroad, however, he has yet to fill in many of the details of how he would conduct policy toward the rest of the world or to resolve ideological rift within his party and his own foreign policy team.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has yet to explain how he would conduct policy toward the Middle East, or to resolve deep ideological rifts within the Republican Party.

headline.seo: Romney Remains Vague on Foreign Policy Details
headline.main: Romney Strives to Stand Apart in Global Policy
headline.print_headline: Romney Strives to Stand Apart in Global Policy

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
